intro: Mariscus cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
